rationale: All four required HPI elements are present: prior stomach upset on sertraline, absence of GI symptoms on fluoxetine, stable mood since dose change, and mention of a hectic work period indicating ongoing work stress. Narrative is concise.
Current medication (fluoxetine) and full adherence are documented, but the 20-mg dose strength and use of a phone reminder are omitted.
Assessment labels MDD as stable, links stability to fluoxetine, and states no change in regimen, fulfilling all requirements.
No suicide or self-harm screening question or result is documented.
No explicit follow-up interval or monitoring instructions are included.
Note stays within provided information; no unsupported ROS, physical exam, or irrelevant data added. Minor system codes are standard metadata.
